title: Greece 'headed for painful euro exit'
desc: Greece's central bank warns for the first time that the country could be on a painful course to default and exit from the eurozone and the EU.

title: Swiss banks 'raised Fifa concerns'
desc: Swiss prosecutors investigating claims of Fifa corruption are probing 53 cases of possible money laundering reported by banks the attorney general says.

title: Escaped tiger kills man in Georgia
desc: A tiger that killed a man and wounded another after escaping from a flooded zoo in Georgia has been shot dead the Georgian interior ministry says.

title: North Korea hit by 'worst drought'
desc: North Korea is facing its worst drought in a century state media says sparking fears of worsening food shortages.

title: Hungary fence to keep out migrants
desc: Hungary says that it will build a fence along its 175 km (109 miles) border with Serbia to keep out migrants.

title: Missing UK sister 'makes contact'
desc: One of three Bradford sisters missing with their nine children has made contact with her family indicating they may already have crossed the border into Syria say police.

title: Controllers wait on Philae link
desc: No new signals have been picked up from the Philae comet lander since a brief radio contact on Sunday but controllers say this is not surprising.

title: 'Old bombs' explode in Nigerian town
desc: A series of explosions in north-eastern Nigeria kills about 20 people reportedly caused by devices found at a former militant camp.

title: 'Ban peacekeepers' from abuse countries
desc: A UN review says countries should be barred from contributing troops to UN missions if their peacekeepers sexually abuse children.

title: 'Heartbreak' over balcony deaths
desc: Families of Irish students killed and injured after a balcony collapsed at a US apartment block are arriving in California.

desc: France's Ecology Minister Segolene Royal urges people to stop eating Nutella because it is made with palm oil and damages the environment.

title: Apple in news app blogger row
desc: Bloggers say they have been invited to join Apple's news app by email and will be automatically bound to its terms unless they opt out.

title: Millions flock to Final Fantasy remake
desc: More than 3.5 million people have watched the online trailer for the remake of Final Fantasy VII since it was unveiled at E3 last night.

title: Florence to be Glastonbury headliner
desc: Florence and the Machine will headline the Pyramid Stage at Glastonbury this year following Foo Fighters' withdrawal from the Friday night slot.

desc: Police say they have found no evidence to suggest a copy of EL James's latest Fifty Shades novel was stolen ahead of its publication this week.

title: Bioenergy 'can deliver cleaner future'
desc: A global bioenergy assessment concludes that biofuels could provide up to a third of the world's transport fuel needs by the middle of the century.

title: More bee species 'must be protected'
desc: Almost 80% of crop pollination by wild bees is provided by just 2% of the most common species say scientists.
